author: VNExplorer
title: The Skin-Nourishing Benefits of Shea Butter: A Nutrition Professional's Guide
text: Shea Butter image Expert opinion from Caroline Luiza C. Castro Master’s in Nutrition Sciences · 16 years of experience · Brazil Shea butter is strongly recommended to improve moisture skin. Actually, its beneficial for many kinds of skin problems, reducing inflammation and also prescribed in some cases of atopic dermatitis. For skin care, shea butter has been used since decades, but to be eaten, in Brazil this kind of butter isn’t popular. Despite having benefits for skin care, some articles also describe shea butter beneficial as a substitute of common butter, reducing inflammation, for example. Expert opinion from Leticia Soares Postgraduate Degree in Public and Family Health/Bachelor Degree in Nutrition and Dietetics · 5 years of experience · Brazil Shea butter in its raw and unrefined version is high in nutrients such as vitamin A and vitamin E and essential fatty acids. It is recommended to use shea butter on the skin, hair, nails and cuticles whenever a deep hydration is desired. Shea butter can help prevent and improve skin problems, such as atopic dermatitis and premature aging, regenerating and strengthening its hydration and softness. → See more questions and expert answers related to Shea Butter. Expert opinion from Marcelli F. Chagas Bachelor in Nutrition · 1 years of experience · Brazil Shea butter is able to prevent and improve skin problems, such as atopic dermatitis, stretch marks and even premature aging, regenerating and strengthening its hydration and softness. This compound can also be used on the nail and lip area to treat dryness. |What are people curious about?| |Mediterranean diet||Keto diet| |Diabetic diet||Weight loss| Disclaimer: This is for information purpose only, and should not be considered as a substitute for medical expertise. These are opinions from an external panel of individual doctors or nutritionists and not to be considered as opinion of Microsoft. Please seek professional help regarding any health conditions or concerns. Medical advice varies across region. Advice from professionals outside your region should be used at your own discretion. author: EFE
title: El huracán Helene se acerca a la categoría 4 y avanza hacia Florida
text: Huracán El huracán Helene alcanza la categoría 4 y ya afecta a Florida El fenómeno, enorme, rápido y "muy peligroso", amenaza con fuertes vientos, una "catastrófica" marejada ciclónica e inundaciones EFE Las fuertes lluvias y vientos del [huracán](/tags/huracan/) Helene, que en el transcurso de este jueves alcanzó la categoría 4, ya han inundado partes de Florida y han dejado sin energía a más de 200.000 viviendas y oficinas de este estado, así como de Georgia y Carolina del Norte. El huracán se ha fortalecido en las últimas horas y, de acuerdo al Centro Nacional de Huracanes (NHC, en inglés), se dirige hacia la costa oeste de Florida con vientos máximos de 215 kilómetros por hora (130 millas), es decir como un huracán mayor (de categoría 3, 4 ó 5). Se prevé que Helene toque tierra esta noche en el noroeste de [Florida](/tags/florida/), en la región del Big Bend, no obstante sus efectos ya han empezado a sentirse en la costa del Golfo de México de este estado. Los medios estadounidenses empiezan a difundir las primeras imágenes de los fuertes vientos y la marea alta en zonas costeras de este sureño estado de [EEUU](/tags/estados-unidos/), mientras que calles en la Bahía de Tampa ya registran inundaciones por las lluvias, que pueden llegar a ser de hasta 50 centímetros en ciertas áreas. De igual modo, más de 173.000 viviendas y oficinas de la costa oeste floridana se encuentran esta tarde sin electricidad tras los impactos de las bandas exteriores del huracán, de acuerdo con la web especializada PowerOutages. Para Florida, la marejada ciclónica que trae consigo Helene podría marcar un récord: de acuerdo a los meteorólogos en algunas áreas subirá el mar hasta 4,5 metros por encima de su nivel promedio, es decir casi dos plantas de un edificio, una marca no vista en este estado. Si no evacua, identifique su cuerpo Más de 30 condados de Florida se hallan con órdenes de evacuación obligatoria. En el condado de Taylor, para aquellos que no las han acatado su alguacil les hizo un pedido particular: "Por favor, escriba su nombre, fecha de nacimiento e información importante en su brazo o pierna con un MARCADOR PERMANENTE para que pueda ser identificado y sus familiares notificados". El Servicio Nacional de Meteorología (NWS, en inglés) de EEUU, ha advertido que en la Bahía de Apalechee, al sur de Tallahassee (la capital del estado), la [marejada ciclónica](/tags/inundaciones/) será "insalvable". Escuelas y oficinas de Florida amanecieron cerradas hoy, y al menos un millar de vuelos con origen o destino a este estado fueron cancelados, a la vez que el aeropuerto de Tampa y otros aeródromos no han operado hoy. Según informan medios locales, en Tallahassee, estudiantes de Florida State University y Florida A&M University que permanecían en sus dormitorios han sido evacuados a albergues donde estarán hasta que pase el huracán. "Va a haber mal tiempo durante la última parte del día aquí en el estado de Florida", alertó hoy el gobernador estatal, Ron DeSantis, quien ha declarado el estado de emergencia, al igual que lo han hecho sus homólogos de Georgia, las Carolinas y Virginia. Un ciclón enorme y veloz Los meteorólogos han puesto de relieve las dimensiones del ciclón, cuyos vientos con fuerza de tormenta tropical se extienden hasta 500 kilómetros (310 millas) de su centro, así como su rapidez, que hacia la tarde hoy se movía hacia el nor-noreste a 37 kilómetros por hora (23 millas). Ambas características ampliarán el alcance de los efectos destructivos de Helene, que de acuerdo al NHC podría tocar tierra con categoría 4. El gobernador de Georgia, Brian Kemp, señaló hoy que Helene puede no ser el huracán con la categoría más fuerte que haya impactado este estado, donde se han impuesto toques de queda en algunas localidades sureñas, pero alertó del "potencial de daño" que cargan sus vientos y que puede causar en todo el estado. "Esta es una de las tormentas más grandes que hemos tenido", dijo durante una rueda de prensa el gobernador de este estado, en donde algunos distritos escolares han cancelado las clases el día viernes. En el oeste de Carolina del Norte, los meteorólogos alertan sobre precipitaciones sin precedentes en tiempos recientes, en especial en localidades como Asheville, que en los últimos dos días ya ha registrado intensas lluvias y a las que se suman ahora las que arroja Helene. El presidente de Estados Unidos, Joe Biden, firmó este jueves una declaración de emergencia para Georgia, como días atrás lo hiciera a favor de Florida, medidas que permiten el envío de asistencia federal, incluidos personal de emergencias y comida, agua y generadores eléctricos. En la noche del jueves, la atención estará en el Big Bend, región no muy poblada donde se prevé que Helene toque tierra, ahí donde en agosto pasado lo hizo el huracán de categoría 1 Debby y por donde en agosto de 2023 también entró el huracán Idalia. author: Brenda Ruggiero STAFF WRITER
title: Nash receives National Field Forester Award
text: OAKLAND — Forester Melissa Nash has received the National Field Forester Award from the USDA Forest Service and the National Association of State Foresters. She serves as the Garrett/Allegany project manager for the Maryland Forest Service of the Department of Natural Resources. The award is given to those who have made a significant contribution toward advancing the Forest Stewardship and Rural Forestry Assistance Program across the landscape. Nominees have demonstrated exceptional leadership and service, consistently delivered a strong program that is a model for other foresters, and found innovative approaches to providing technical assistance to landowners and partners. Nash was previously recognized as the Maryland Forester of the Year and Northeast-Midwest State Foresters Alliance Forester of the Year in 2020. “I’m honored,” Nash said. “I just found out about the award about a week or so beforehand, so it was a pleasant surprise. It means a lot to have my work recognized. I’ve also had a lot of support and been a part of many great partnerships that have enabled me to do the work I’ve done.” Nash graduated from Allegany College of Maryland with an AAS in Forest Technology (2008) and WVU with a BS in Forest Resource Management (2010). She began working seasonally for the Maryland Forest Service at Green Ridge State Forest while still in school. In 2011, she was hired full time as a watershed forester. She worked in Maryland’s four western counties with private landowners on buffer planting projects, coordinated the Backyard Buffers program and coordinated management activities on the Frederick City Watershed. “In 2015, I accepted the Garrett County Project Manager position for the Maryland Forest Service, where I have been providing management assistance and support to 350+ private landowners on 20,000+ acres,” Nash said. This includes helping landowners plan tree planting projects, giving recommendations for commercial and non-commercial forest harvest operations, invasive plant control and prescribing burning, wildfire response, educational and outreach programs. In her current position, Nash also serves as secretary of the Garrett County Forestry Board. In 2023, the Garrett and Allegany projects were merged into the Garrett-Allegany Project, so she now oversees the stewardship staff in both counties. “I get to meet a lot of interesting people,” Nash said in speaking about her favorite part of the job. “Some have a long family history with their property to share, while others may be new forest landowners. They all have goals for the future and I’m able to help them achieve those goals.” Nash noted that sometimes this does take time or she may have to get creative and utilize multiple/different funding sources and involve different partners. “But it’s really rewarding to come back a few years down the road and see a tree planting, invasive plant control or thinning project and how their forest has benefitted from it,” she said. Nash said she grew up near Frostburg, but spent a lot of time in Garrett County as a kid, especially fishing with her Granddad. She’s lived near Grantsville since 2014. “My husband Kenny and I typically spend our free time centered around our hunting dogs,” she said. “We have Bluetick coonhounds and Mountain Feist squirrel dogs. We enjoy hunting locally for raccoon and squirrel and also travel frequently to participate in show and hunt performance events with our dogs. We are active in local hunting clubs in Maryland and Pennsylvania.” The couple also enjoys fishing, camping and foraging for mushrooms. Nash volunteers with the 4-H program in the county and have been a 4-H volunteer for 15 years.

author: Lucy
title: CAST Group of Companies Announces ProAUDIO-AVT as BlackTrax Distributor in Poland
text:
Toronto, Canada – February 27, 2025 – CAST Group of Companies is proud to announce that ProAUDIO-AVT has been appointed as a new distributor of BlackTrax in Poland. This partnership marks a significant expansion of BlackTrax’s presence in the region, ensuring that customers across Poland, the Czech Republic, and Slovakia receive top-tier service and support for their real-time tracking needs.
ProAUDIO-AVT, a leading distributor of professional audio and multimedia solutions, has been serving the Polish market since 1989. Headquartered in Wrocław with branches in Warsaw, Kraków, and Gdynia, the company has built a strong reputation for providing cutting-edge technology, expert consulting, and comprehensive customer support.
Tomasz Kwiecień, President and Owner of ProAUDIO-AVT, expressed enthusiasm for the partnership: “Our company has been at the forefront of the professional audio and multimedia market for decades. Partnering with CAST Group to distribute BlackTrax is a natural step in our mission to provide high-quality, innovative solutions to our customers. We look forward to supporting the pro audio and multimedia communities in Poland, the Czech Republic, and Slovakia with this groundbreaking technology.”
With a team of nearly twenty specialists, ProAUDIO-AVT is committed to delivering full-scale support, project consulting, and both warranty and post-warranty services. This collaboration between CAST Group and ProAUDIO-AVT is expected to drive greater adoption of BlackTrax technology across live events, theater productions, and other entertainment applications.
“We are excited to welcome ProAUDIO-AVT as a distributor in Poland,” said Dekkar Densham, Global Sales Director at CAST Group. “Their extensive experience in the industry and commitment to excellence make them a perfect partner. We look forward to seeing how their expertise will help expand our reach and enhance the experiences of customers across the region.
Pictured: Tomasz Kwiecień, President and Owner of ProAUDIO-AVT and Dekkar Densham, Global Sales Director, CAST Group of Companies
